RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Sanchez's parents: Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father and Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: Defendant and appellant convicted of conspiracy to bring or attempt to bring undocumented aliens into the United States, involved in smuggling operation with Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, charged with conspiracy and aiding and abetting, raises several claims of prejudicial error on appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Graciela Castaneda: Witness for the appellant, testified about having brunch with the appellant on November 22, 1980, and provided alibi testimony, stated that Ortega-Chavez had been in San Antonio on the day in question
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez: Co-conspirator, van driver, and participant in the smuggling operation with Ortega-Chavez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, arrested at the bridge for attempting to smuggle illegal aliens into the United States, related to rebuttal witnesses who testified against the appellant's alibi
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father: Rebuttal witness who testified that the appellant was in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 22, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother: Rebuttal witness who testified that she saw the appellant in Sabinas Hidalgo on the evening of November 21, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ms. Salinas: Defense counsel and acquaintance of juror Mrs. Guerrero, subject of inquiry regarding her firm and its members, defense counsel in the case of Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, underwent inquiry respecting herself and her firm
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: Trial court judge who handled the situation commendably and ensured a fair trial by conducting an inquiry into juror Mrs. Guerrero's ability to remain impartial, able trial judge conducted all the proceedings not only fairly, conscientiously, and competently but in a manner that was in all respects fully considerate, courteous, evenhanded, and impartial
